[/quote]#include <stdbool.h>[/quote]Oh. All my C books are pre-1999.

Read full topic

item.title: Some help with C
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

OP: it’s not that hard to write C; it is, however, difficult to create an effective solution when you’re used to OO. Based on this, I’d recommend making problems and solving them in C.

Read full topic

item.title: Some help with C
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:7, topic:448879”][quote author=s1gma link=topic=551774.msg4042757#msg4042757 date=1341796799]
that code is almost completely C

you should be using cout rather than printf in you’re using c++…

std::cout << "first is equal to " << first << std::endl;

http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/iostream/cout/

edit:
here’s printf’s replacement codes
http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/clibrary/cstdio/printf/

edit2:
Lin, integrals are %d
[/quote]signed integers are %d or %i (read your own link plz)

im pretty sure my compiler yelled at me for %i because it wasn’t ansi or something[/quote]

[code][kyle@doris ~] cat lol.c
#include <stdio.h>

int main(void)
{
printf("%i", 29);
return 0;
}

[kyle@doris ~] CFLAGS="-Wall -Wextra -pedantic -std=c99" make lol
cc -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -std=c99 lol.c -o lol
[kyle@doris ~] ./lol
29[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Some help with C
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

IIRC, to include values in a string, you’d do something like this:

printf("Please enter the sum of %i + 2\n", first);I haven’t wrote any C++ console applications since I was 11, so my memory on it is a bit… old. The %i might actually be %d, or %x.

Read full topic

item.title: Some help with C
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

I’m trying to learn a new language because I am tired of Java, so I decided to learn C++.

Here’s the start of my code I wrote, but I ran into some problems…


#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <stdbool.h>

bool solve(int first, int second, int estimatedsum)
{
    return first + second == estimatedsum;
}

int generatefirst()
{
    return 4;//will change soon
}

int generatesecond()
{
    return 6;//will change this into something more soon
}

int main()
{
    int first = generatefirst();
    int second = generatesecond();
    int value;
    printf("Please enter the sum of %first + 2\n");
    scanf("%d", &value);
    bool last = solve(first, second, value);
    if(last == true)
    {
        printf("That is correct.");
    }
    else
    {
        printf("That is wrong.");
    }
    printf("\n");
    getchar();
    return 0;
}

Here:
printf(“Please enter the sum of %first + 2\n”);

I’m trying to input the int ‘first’ into the string, but nothing I try works…

If you see anything that could be shortened or a start of any bad habits, please let me know.

Read full topic
